intro: Rhinephyllum broomii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Rhinephyllum broomii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
